content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice! 

Idk if you are able to figure it out in reverse. You should put a hint in the stub generator.
Like:

read N:int
loop N read id:int damage:int cooldown:float
write dps (damage per second) = damage / cooldown

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: makes sense and is very quick to solve, may work better as a shortest solution

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Mainly for reverse and golf, but not useless for speed.

Goal
* Please add ", defined as [[damage]] divided by [[cooldown]]" after "second".

Input
* Please change "[[N]] Lines" to "Next [[N]] Lines".

* Please add "(integer)" after "[[id]]" and "[[damage]]".

* Please add "(float)" after "[[cooldown]]".

* Please add ", separated by a space" after "[[cooldown]]".

Output
* Please change "A single line which contains the" to "<<Line 1:>> The".

Constraints
* Please add as the first constraint:
2 ≤ [[N]] ≤ 4

* Please add as the final constraint:
No two units have the same damage per second in each case.

Cases
* Each test and validator should cover the same scenario, with slightly different inputs and outputs. Currently, some pairs are not matched:

  • [[damage]] is limited to 1-10 in some validators, but uses values >10 in corresponding tests.

  • [[cooldown]] values are floats in tests, but integers in validators.
  
  • A [[cooldown]] value with 3 decimal places appears in a validator only.
  
  Please revise all cases so that each test and its validator are similar.

* Also, please ensure that no two units share the same damage per second in any case, regardless of whether the value is the highest.

Thanks.
Thanks for the helpful advice -- I tried my best to revise it according to your suggestions!

Thank you. We're almost there!

Constraints
* The first constraint should be split into two:
2 ≤ [[N]] ≤ 4
1 ≤ [[id]] ≤ 4

* Please change 7 to 1.

Cases
* Validator 4: Please swap unit 3 and unit 4 so that the output is 4.
I've finished making the changes here, it should be good now.
